intro: Graptophyllum nortonii, commonly known as the Norton's graptophyllum, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and produces small, star-shaped flowers. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought and high sunlight exposure. Its unique morphology and ecological role make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
